content.rendered:
Adobe is a name we are all familiar with, and rightly so. The company created the PDF format, and among its product offering are Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign, along with many others. In recent years, Adobe has shifted to a subscription SaaS model, offering its products as a bundle on Adobe Creative Cloud at quite an expense.

The company has survived Covid better than almost any other company. The company’s fiscal 2020 revenues hit $12.8 billion, up nearly 14% from 2019, and growth has continued into its first quarter of fiscal 2021.

Wall Street analysts are well unified in their views on Adobe – Let’s see what the Valutico valuations says:

–> Today’s Market Cap: $239 Billion
–> Valutico’s DCF Valuation: $110 Billion

What do you think about Adobe?

Link to the valuation: https://www.valutico.com/companies/adobe-inc-c2ad9421-3377-4052-9e47-d2031b34c236/evaluations/43-GKLuuwuyYhprTmpz-5btEjdXuR_fTYYXHtYzSAfip5n01V-WbEhMMwhK29ZxhJ2ifUfPvPvhn-yeD-2f0pQ/share
